      43                 :            : namespace boost {

      45                 :            : /*!
      46                 :            :     \class circular_buffer
      47                 :            :     \brief Circular buffer - a STL compliant container.
      48                 :            :     \param T The type of the elements stored in the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
      49                 :            :     \par Type Requirements T
      50                 :            :          The <code>T</code> has to be <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/Assignable.html">
      51                 :            :          SGIAssignable</a> (SGI STL defined combination of <a href="../../utility/Assignable.html">
      52                 :            :          Assignable</a> and <a href="../../utility/CopyConstructible.html">CopyConstructible</a>).
      53                 :            :          Moreover <code>T</code> has to be <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/DefaultConstructible.html">
      54                 :            :          DefaultConstructible</a> if supplied as a default parameter when invoking some of the
      55                 :            :          <code>circular_buffer</code>'s methods e.g.
      56                 :            :          <code>insert(iterator pos, const value_type& item = %value_type())</code>. And
      57                 :            :          <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/EqualityComparable.html">EqualityComparable</a> and/or
      58                 :            :          <a href="../../utility/LessThanComparable.html">LessThanComparable</a> if the <code>circular_buffer</code>
      59                 :            :          will be compared with another container.
      60                 :            :     \param Alloc The allocator type used for all internal memory management.
      61                 :            :     \par Type Requirements Alloc
      62                 :            :          The <code>Alloc</code> has to meet the allocator requirements imposed by STL.
      63                 :            :     \par Default Alloc
      64                 :            :          std::allocator<T>
      65                 :            : 
      66                 :            :     For detailed documentation of the circular_buffer visit:
      67                 :            :     http://www.boost.org/libs/circular_buffer/doc/circular_buffer.html
      68                 :            : */

     450                 :            :         \return A reference to the last element of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     451                 :            :         \throws Nothing.

     457                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     458                 :            :         \sa <code>front()</code>
     459                 :            :     */
     460                 :        780 :     reference back() {
     461         [ -  + ]:        780 :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(!empty()); // check for empty buffer (back element not available)
     462         [ +  + ]:        780 :         return *((m_last == m_buff ? m_end : m_last) - 1);
     463                 :            :     }
     464                 :            : 
     465                 :            :     //! Get the first element.
     466                 :            :     /*!
     467                 :            :         \pre <code>!empty()</code>
     468                 :            :         \return A const reference to the first element of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     469                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
     470                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     471                 :            :              No-throw.
     472                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     473                 :            :              Does not invalidate any iterators.
     474                 :            :         \par Complexity
     475                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     476                 :            :         \sa <code>back() const</code>
     477                 :            :     */
     478                 :            :     return_value_type front() const {

     483                 :            :     //! Get the last element.
     484                 :            :     /*!

     486                 :            :         \return A const reference to the last element of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.

     491                 :            :              Does not invalidate any iterators.

     493                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     494                 :            :         \sa <code>front() const</code>
     495                 :            :     */
     496                 :            :     return_value_type back() const {
     497                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(!empty()); // check for empty buffer (back element not available)
     498                 :            :         return *((m_last == m_buff ? m_end : m_last) - 1);
     499                 :            :     }
     500                 :            : 
     501                 :            :     //! Get the first continuous array of the internal buffer.
     502                 :            :     /*!
     503                 :            :         This method in combination with <code>array_two()</code> can be useful when passing the stored data into
     504                 :            :         a legacy C API as an array. Suppose there is a <code>circular_buffer</code> of capacity 10, containing 7
     505                 :            :         characters <code>'a', 'b', ..., 'g'</code> where <code>buff[0] == 'a'</code>, <code>buff[1] == 'b'</code>,
     506                 :            :         ... and <code>buff[6] == 'g'</code>:<br><br>
     507                 :            :         <code>circular_buffer<char> buff(10);</code><br><br>
     508                 :            :         The internal representation is often not linear and the state of the internal buffer may look like this:<br>
     509                 :            :         <br><code>
     510                 :            :         |e|f|g| | | |a|b|c|d|<br>
     511                 :            :         end ---^<br>
     512                 :            :         begin -------^</code><br><br>
     513                 :            :         where <code>|a|b|c|d|</code> represents the "array one", <code>|e|f|g|</code> represents the "array two" and
     514                 :            :         <code>| | | |</code> is a free space.<br>
     515                 :            :         Now consider a typical C style function for writing data into a file:<br><br>
     516                 :            :         <code>int write(int file_desc, char* buff, int num_bytes);</code><br><br>
     517                 :            :         There are two ways how to write the content of the <code>circular_buffer</code> into a file. Either relying
     518                 :            :         on <code>array_one()</code> and <code>array_two()</code> methods and calling the write function twice:<br><br>
     519                 :            :         <code>array_range ar = buff.array_one();<br>
     520                 :            :         write(file_desc, ar.first, ar.second);<br>
     521                 :            :         ar = buff.array_two();<br>
     522                 :            :         write(file_desc, ar.first, ar.second);</code><br><br>
     523                 :            :         Or relying on the <code>linearize()</code> method:<br><br><code>
     524                 :            :         write(file_desc, buff.linearize(), buff.size());</code><br><br>
     525                 :            :         Since the complexity of <code>array_one()</code> and <code>array_two()</code> methods is constant the first
     526                 :            :         option is suitable when calling the write method is "cheap". On the other hand the second option is more
     527                 :            :         suitable when calling the write method is more "expensive" than calling the <code>linearize()</code> method
     528                 :            :         whose complexity is linear.
     529                 :            :         \return The array range of the first continuous array of the internal buffer. In the case the
     530                 :            :                 <code>circular_buffer</code> is empty the size of the returned array is <code>0</code>.
     531                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
     532                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     533                 :            :              No-throw.
     534                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     535                 :            :              Does not invalidate any iterators.
     536                 :            :         \par Complexity
     537                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     538                 :            :         \warning In general invoking any method which modifies the internal state of the circular_buffer  may
     539                 :            :                  delinearize the internal buffer and invalidate the array ranges returned by <code>array_one()</code>
     540                 :            :                  and <code>array_two()</code> (and their const versions).
     541                 :            :         \note In the case the internal buffer is linear e.g. <code>|a|b|c|d|e|f|g| | | |</code> the "array one" is
     542                 :            :               represented by <code>|a|b|c|d|e|f|g|</code> and the "array two" does not exist (the
     543                 :            :               <code>array_two()</code> method returns an array with the size <code>0</code>).
     544                 :            :         \sa <code>array_two()</code>, <code>linearize()</code>
     545                 :            :     */
     546                 :            :     array_range array_one() {
     547                 :            :         return array_range(m_first, (m_last <= m_first && !empty() ? m_end : m_last) - m_first);
     548                 :            :     }
     549                 :            : 
     550                 :            :     //! Get the second continuous array of the internal buffer.
     551                 :            :     /*!
     552                 :            :         This method in combination with <code>array_one()</code> can be useful when passing the stored data into
     553                 :            :         a legacy C API as an array.
     554                 :            :         \return The array range of the second continuous array of the internal buffer. In the case the internal buffer
     555                 :            :                 is linear or the <code>circular_buffer</code> is empty the size of the returned array is
     556                 :            :                 <code>0</code>.
     557                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
     558                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     559                 :            :              No-throw.
     560                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     561                 :            :              Does not invalidate any iterators.
     562                 :            :         \par Complexity
     563                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     564                 :            :         \sa <code>array_one()</code>
     565                 :            :     */
     566                 :            :     array_range array_two() {
     567                 :            :         return array_range(m_buff, m_last <= m_first && !empty() ? m_last - m_buff : 0);
     568                 :            :     }
     569                 :            : 
     570                 :            :     //! Get the first continuous array of the internal buffer.
     571                 :            :     /*!
     572                 :            :         This method in combination with <code>array_two() const</code> can be useful when passing the stored data into
     573                 :            :         a legacy C API as an array.
     574                 :            :         \return The array range of the first continuous array of the internal buffer. In the case the
     575                 :            :                 <code>circular_buffer</code> is empty the size of the returned array is <code>0</code>.
     576                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
     577                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     578                 :            :              No-throw.
     579                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     580                 :            :              Does not invalidate any iterators.
     581                 :            :         \par Complexity
     582                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     583                 :            :         \sa <code>array_two() const</code>; <code>array_one()</code> for more details how to pass data into a legacy C
     584                 :            :             API.
     585                 :            :     */
     586                 :            :     const_array_range array_one() const {
     587                 :            :         return const_array_range(m_first, (m_last <= m_first && !empty() ? m_end : m_last) - m_first);
     588                 :            :     }
     589                 :            : 
     590                 :            :     //! Get the second continuous array of the internal buffer.
     591                 :            :     /*!
     592                 :            :         This method in combination with <code>array_one() const</code> can be useful when passing the stored data into
     593                 :            :         a legacy C API as an array.
     594                 :            :         \return The array range of the second continuous array of the internal buffer. In the case the internal buffer
     595                 :            :                 is linear or the <code>circular_buffer</code> is empty the size of the returned array is
     596                 :            :                 <code>0</code>.
     597                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
     598                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     599                 :            :              No-throw.
     600                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     601                 :            :              Does not invalidate any iterators.
     602                 :            :         \par Complexity
     603                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     604                 :            :         \sa <code>array_one() const</code>
     605                 :            :     */
     606                 :            :     const_array_range array_two() const {
     607                 :            :         return const_array_range(m_buff, m_last <= m_first && !empty() ? m_last - m_buff : 0);
     608                 :            :     }
     609                 :            : 
     610                 :            :     //! Linearize the internal buffer into a continuous array.
     611                 :            :     /*!
     612                 :            :         This method can be useful when passing the stored data into a legacy C API as an array.
     613                 :            :         \post <code>\&(*this)[0] \< \&(*this)[1] \< ... \< \&(*this)[size() - 1]</code>
     614                 :            :         \return A pointer to the beginning of the array or <code>0</code> if empty.
     615                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
     616                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
     617                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     618                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operations in the <i>Throws</i> section do not throw anything.
     619                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     620                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
     621                 :            :              <code>end()</code>); does not invalidate any iterators if the postcondition (the <i>Effect</i>) is already
     622                 :            :              met prior calling this method.
     623                 :            :         \par Complexity
     624                 :            :              Linear (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>); constant if the postcondition (the
     625                 :            :              <i>Effect</i>) is already met.
     626                 :            :         \warning In general invoking any method which modifies the internal state of the <code>circular_buffer</code>
     627                 :            :                  may delinearize the internal buffer and invalidate the returned pointer.
     628                 :            :         \sa <code>array_one()</code> and <code>array_two()</code> for the other option how to pass data into a legacy
     629                 :            :             C API; <code>is_linearized()</code>, <code>rotate(const_iterator)</code>
     630                 :            :     */
     631                 :            :     pointer linearize() {
     632                 :            :         if (empty())
     633                 :            :             return 0;
     634                 :            :         if (m_first < m_last || m_last == m_buff)
     635                 :            :             return m_first;
     636                 :            :         pointer src = m_first;
     637                 :            :         pointer dest = m_buff;
     638                 :            :         size_type moved = 0;
     639                 :            :         size_type constructed = 0;
     640                 :            :         BOOST_TRY {
     641                 :            :             for (pointer first = m_first; dest < src; src = first) {
     642                 :            :                 for (size_type ii = 0; src < m_end; ++src, ++dest, ++moved, ++ii) {
     643                 :            :                     if (moved == size()) {
     644                 :            :                         first = dest;
     645                 :            :                         break;
     646                 :            :                     }
     647                 :            :                     if (dest == first) {
     648                 :            :                         first += ii;
     649                 :            :                         break;
     650                 :            :                     }
     651                 :            :                     if (is_uninitialized(dest)) {
     652                 :            :                         m_alloc.construct(dest, *src);
     653                 :            :                         ++constructed;
     654                 :            :                     } else {
     655                 :            :                         value_type tmp = *src;
     656                 :            :                         replace(src, *dest);
     657                 :            :                         replace(dest, tmp);
     658                 :            :                     }
     659                 :            :                 }
     660                 :            :             }
     661                 :            :         } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
     662                 :            :             m_last += constructed;
     663                 :            :             m_size += constructed;
     664                 :            :             BOOST_RETHROW
     665                 :            :         }
     666                 :            :         BOOST_CATCH_END
     667                 :            :         for (src = m_end - constructed; src < m_end; ++src)
     668                 :            :             destroy_item(src);
     669                 :            :         m_first = m_buff;
     670                 :            :         m_last = add(m_buff, size());
     671                 :            : #if BOOST_CB_ENABLE_DEBUG
     672                 :            :         invalidate_iterators_except(end());
     673                 :            : #endif
     674                 :            :         return m_buff;
     675                 :            :     }
     676                 :            : 
     677                 :            :     //! Is the <code>circular_buffer</code> linearized?
     678                 :            :     /*!
     679                 :            :         \return <code>true</code> if the internal buffer is linearized into a continuous array (i.e. the
     680                 :            :                 <code>circular_buffer</code> meets a condition
     681                 :            :                 <code>\&(*this)[0] \< \&(*this)[1] \< ... \< \&(*this)[size() - 1]</code>);
     682                 :            :                 <code>false</code> otherwise.
     683                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
     684                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     685                 :            :              No-throw.
     686                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     687                 :            :              Does not invalidate any iterators.
     688                 :            :         \par Complexity
     689                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     690                 :            :         \sa <code>linearize()</code>, <code>array_one()</code>, <code>array_two()</code>
     691                 :            :     */
     692                 :            :     bool is_linearized() const { return m_first < m_last || m_last == m_buff; }
     693                 :            : 
     694                 :            :     //! Rotate elements in the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     695                 :            :     /*!
     696                 :            :         A more effective implementation of
     697                 :            :         <code><a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/rotate.html">std::rotate</a></code>.
     698                 :            :         \pre <code>new_begin</code> is a valid iterator pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> <b>except</b> its
     699                 :            :              end.
     700                 :            :         \post Before calling the method suppose:<br><br>
     701                 :            :               <code>m == std::distance(new_begin, end())</code><br><code>n == std::distance(begin(), new_begin)</code>
     702                 :            :               <br><code>val_0 == *new_begin, val_1 == *(new_begin + 1), ... val_m == *(new_begin + m)</code><br>
     703                 :            :               <code>val_r1 == *(new_begin - 1), val_r2 == *(new_begin - 2), ... val_rn == *(new_begin - n)</code><br>
     704                 :            :               <br>then after call to the method:<br><br>
     705                 :            :               <code>val_0 == (*this)[0] \&\& val_1 == (*this)[1] \&\& ... \&\& val_m == (*this)[m - 1] \&\& val_r1 ==
     706                 :            :               (*this)[m + n - 1] \&\& val_r2 == (*this)[m + n - 2] \&\& ... \&\& val_rn == (*this)[m]</code>
     707                 :            :         \param new_begin The new beginning.
     708                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
     709                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
     710                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     711                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the <code>circular_buffer</code> is full or <code>new_begin</code> points to
     712                 :            :              <code>begin()</code> or if the operations in the <i>Throws</i> section do not throw anything.
     713                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     714                 :            :              If <code>m \< n</code> invalidates iterators pointing to the last <code>m</code> elements
     715                 :            :              (<b>including</b> <code>new_begin</code>, but not iterators equal to <code>end()</code>) else invalidates
     716                 :            :              iterators pointing to the first <code>n</code> elements; does not invalidate any iterators if the
     717                 :            :              <code>circular_buffer</code> is full.
     718                 :            :         \par Complexity
     719                 :            :              Linear (in <code>(std::min)(m, n)</code>); constant if the <code>circular_buffer</code> is full.
     720                 :            :         \sa <code><a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/rotate.html">std::rotate</a></code>
     721                 :            :     */
     722                 :            :     void rotate(const_iterator new_begin) {
     723                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(new_begin.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
     724                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(new_begin.m_it != 0);      // check for iterator pointing to end()
     725                 :            :         if (full()) {
     726                 :            :             m_first = m_last = const_cast<pointer>(new_begin.m_it);
     727                 :            :         } else {
     728                 :            :             difference_type m = end() - new_begin;
     729                 :            :             difference_type n = new_begin - begin();
     730                 :            :             if (m < n) {
     731                 :            :                 for (; m > 0; --m) {
     732                 :            :                     push_front(back());
     733                 :            :                     pop_back();
     734                 :            :                 }
     735                 :            :             } else {
     736                 :            :                 for (; n > 0; --n) {
     737                 :            :                     push_back(front());
     738                 :            :                     pop_front();
     739                 :            :                 }
     740                 :            :             }
     741                 :            :         }
     742                 :            :     }
     743                 :            : 
     744                 :            : // Size and capacity
     745                 :            : 
     746                 :            :     //! Get the number of elements currently stored in the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     747                 :            :     /*!
     748                 :            :         \return The number of elements stored in the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     749                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
     750                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     751                 :            :              No-throw.
     752                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     753                 :            :              Does not invalidate any iterators.
     754                 :            :         \par Complexity
     755                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     756                 :            :         \sa <code>capacity()</code>, <code>max_size()</code>, <code>reserve()</code>,
     757                 :            :             <code>\link resize() resize(size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>
     758                 :            :     */
     759                 :      21988 :     size_type size() const { return m_size; }
     760                 :            :

     777                 :            :     //! Is the <code>circular_buffer</code> empty?

     792                 :            :     //! Is the <code>circular_buffer</code> full?

     805                 :       1806 :     bool full() const { return capacity() == size(); }
     806                 :            : 
     807                 :            :     /*! \brief Get the maximum number of elements which can be inserted into the <code>circular_buffer</code> without

     821                 :            :     //! Get the capacity of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     822                 :            :     /*!
     823                 :            :         \return The maximum number of elements which can be stored in the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     824                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
     825                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     826                 :            :              No-throw.
     827                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     828                 :            :              Does not invalidate any iterators.
     829                 :            :         \par Complexity
     830                 :            :              Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     831                 :            :         \sa <code>reserve()</code>, <code>size()</code>, <code>max_size()</code>,
     832                 :            :             <code>set_capacity(capacity_type)</code>
     833                 :            :     */
     834                 :       5316 :     capacity_type capacity() const { return m_end - m_buff; }
     835                 :            : 
     836                 :            :     //! Change the capacity of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     837                 :            :     /*!
     838                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == new_capacity \&\& size() \<= new_capacity</code><br><br>
     839                 :            :               If the current number of elements stored in the <code>circular_buffer</code> is greater than the desired
     840                 :            :               new capacity then number of <code>[size() - new_capacity]</code> <b>last</b> elements will be removed and
     841                 :            :               the new size will be equal to <code>new_capacity</code>.
     842                 :            :         \param new_capacity The new capacity.
     843                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
     844                 :            :                 used).
     845                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
     846                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     847                 :            :              Strong.
     848                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     849                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
     850                 :            :              <code>end()</code>) if the new capacity is different from the original.
     851                 :            :         \par Complexity
     852                 :            :              Linear (in <code>min[size(), new_capacity]</code>).
     853                 :            :         \sa <code>rset_capacity(capacity_type)</code>,
     854                 :            :             <code>\link resize() resize(size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>
     855                 :            :     */
     856                 :          7 :     void set_capacity(capacity_type new_capacity) {
     857 [ +  - ][ -  + ]:          7 :         if (new_capacity == capacity())
     858                 :          7 :             return;
     859         [ +  - ]:          7 :         pointer buff = allocate(new_capacity);
     860         [ +  - ]:          7 :         iterator b = begin();
     861                 :            :         BOOST_TRY {
     862         [ +  - ]:          7 :             reset(buff,
     863 [ +  - ][ +  - ]:          7 :                 cb_details::uninitialized_copy_with_alloc(b, b + (std::min)(new_capacity, size()), buff, m_alloc),
     864 [ +  - ][ +  - ]:         14 :                 new_capacity);
                 [ +  - ]
     865                 :          0 :         } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
     866         [ #  # ]:          0 :             deallocate(buff, new_capacity);
     867                 :          0 :             BOOST_RETHROW
     868                 :            :         }
     869                 :          7 :         BOOST_CATCH_END
     870                 :            :     }
     871                 :            : 
     872                 :            :     //! Change the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     873                 :            :     /*!
     874                 :            :         \post <code>size() == new_size \&\& capacity() >= new_size</code><br><br>
     875                 :            :               If the new size is greater than the current size, copies of <code>item</code> will be inserted at the
     876                 :            :               <b>back</b> of the of the <code>circular_buffer</code> in order to achieve the desired size. In the case
     877                 :            :               the resulting size exceeds the current capacity the capacity will be set to <code>new_size</code>.<br>
     878                 :            :               If the current number of elements stored in the <code>circular_buffer</code> is greater than the desired
     879                 :            :               new size then number of <code>[size() - new_size]</code> <b>last</b> elements will be removed. (The
     880                 :            :               capacity will remain unchanged.)
     881                 :            :         \param new_size The new size.
     882                 :            :         \param item The element the <code>circular_buffer</code> will be filled with in order to gain the requested
     883                 :            :                     size. (See the <i>Effect</i>.)
     884                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
     885                 :            :                 used).
     886                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
     887                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     888                 :            :              Basic.
     889                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     890                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
     891                 :            :              <code>end()</code>) if the new size is greater than the current capacity. Invalidates iterators pointing
     892                 :            :              to the removed elements if the new size is lower that the original size. Otherwise it does not invalidate
     893                 :            :              any iterator.
     894                 :            :         \par Complexity
     895                 :            :              Linear (in the new size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     896                 :            :         \sa <code>\link rresize() rresize(size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>,
     897                 :            :             <code>set_capacity(capacity_type)</code>
     898                 :            :     */
     899                 :            :     void resize(size_type new_size, param_value_type item = value_type()) {
     900                 :            :         if (new_size > size()) {
     901                 :            :             if (new_size > capacity())
     902                 :            :                 set_capacity(new_size);
     903                 :            :             insert(end(), new_size - size(), item);
     904                 :            :         } else {
     905                 :            :             iterator e = end();
     906                 :            :             erase(e - (size() - new_size), e);
     907                 :            :         }
     908                 :            :     }
     909                 :            : 
     910                 :            :     //! Change the capacity of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     911                 :            :     /*!
     912                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == new_capacity \&\& size() \<= new_capacity</code><br><br>
     913                 :            :               If the current number of elements stored in the <code>circular_buffer</code> is greater than the desired
     914                 :            :               new capacity then number of <code>[size() - new_capacity]</code> <b>first</b> elements will be removed
     915                 :            :               and the new size will be equal to <code>new_capacity</code>.
     916                 :            :         \param new_capacity The new capacity.
     917                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
     918                 :            :                 used).
     919                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
     920                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     921                 :            :              Strong.
     922                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     923                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
     924                 :            :              <code>end()</code>) if the new capacity is different from the original.
     925                 :            :         \par Complexity
     926                 :            :              Linear (in <code>min[size(), new_capacity]</code>).
     927                 :            :         \sa <code>set_capacity(capacity_type)</code>,
     928                 :            :             <code>\link rresize() rresize(size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>
     929                 :            :     */
     930                 :            :     void rset_capacity(capacity_type new_capacity) {
     931                 :            :         if (new_capacity == capacity())
     932                 :            :             return;
     933                 :            :         pointer buff = allocate(new_capacity);
     934                 :            :         iterator e = end();
     935                 :            :         BOOST_TRY {
     936                 :            :             reset(buff, cb_details::uninitialized_copy_with_alloc(e - (std::min)(new_capacity, size()),
     937                 :            :                 e, buff, m_alloc), new_capacity);
     938                 :            :         } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
     939                 :            :             deallocate(buff, new_capacity);
     940                 :            :             BOOST_RETHROW
     941                 :            :         }
     942                 :            :         BOOST_CATCH_END
     943                 :            :     }
     944                 :            : 
     945                 :            :     //! Change the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
     946                 :            :     /*!
     947                 :            :         \post <code>size() == new_size \&\& capacity() >= new_size</code><br><br>
     948                 :            :               If the new size is greater than the current size, copies of <code>item</code> will be inserted at the
     949                 :            :               <b>front</b> of the of the <code>circular_buffer</code> in order to achieve the desired size. In the case
     950                 :            :               the resulting size exceeds the current capacity the capacity will be set to <code>new_size</code>.<br>
     951                 :            :               If the current number of elements stored in the <code>circular_buffer</code> is greater than the desired
     952                 :            :               new size then number of <code>[size() - new_size]</code> <b>first</b> elements will be removed. (The
     953                 :            :               capacity will remain unchanged.)
     954                 :            :         \param new_size The new size.
     955                 :            :         \param item The element the <code>circular_buffer</code> will be filled with in order to gain the requested
     956                 :            :                     size. (See the <i>Effect</i>.)
     957                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
     958                 :            :                 used).
     959                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
     960                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
     961                 :            :              Basic.
     962                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
     963                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
     964                 :            :              <code>end()</code>) if the new size is greater than the current capacity. Invalidates iterators pointing
     965                 :            :              to the removed elements if the new size is lower that the original size. Otherwise it does not invalidate
     966                 :            :              any iterator.
     967                 :            :         \par Complexity
     968                 :            :              Linear (in the new size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>).
     969                 :            :         \sa <code>\link resize() resize(size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>,
     970                 :            :             <code>rset_capacity(capacity_type)</code>
     971                 :            :     */
     972                 :            :     void rresize(size_type new_size, param_value_type item = value_type()) {
     973                 :            :         if (new_size > size()) {
     974                 :            :             if (new_size > capacity())
     975                 :            :                 set_capacity(new_size);
     976                 :            :             rinsert(begin(), new_size - size(), item);
     977                 :            :         } else {
     978                 :            :             rerase(begin(), end() - new_size);
     979                 :            :         }
     980                 :            :     }

     984                 :            :     //! Create an empty <code>circular_buffer</code> with zero capacity.
     985                 :            :     /*!
     986                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == 0 \&\& size() == 0</code>
     987                 :            :         \param alloc The allocator.
     988                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
     989                 :            :                 used).
     990                 :            :         \par Complexity
     991                 :            :              Constant.
     992                 :            :         \warning Since Boost version 1.36 the behaviour of this constructor has changed. Now the constructor does not
     993                 :            :                  allocate any memory and both capacity and size are set to zero. Also note when inserting an element
     994                 :            :                  into a <code>circular_buffer</code> with zero capacity (e.g. by
     995                 :            :                  <code>\link push_back() push_back(const_reference)\endlink</code> or
     996                 :            :                  <code>\link insert(iterator, param_value_type) insert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>) nothing
     997                 :            :                  will be inserted and the size (as well as capacity) remains zero.
     998                 :            :         \note You can explicitly set the capacity by calling the <code>set_capacity(capacity_type)</code> method or you
     999                 :            :               can use the other constructor with the capacity specified.
    1000                 :            :         \sa <code>circular_buffer(capacity_type, const allocator_type& alloc)</code>,
    1001                 :            :             <code>set_capacity(capacity_type)</code>
    1002                 :            :     */
    1003                 :          7 :     explicit circular_buffer(const allocator_type& alloc = allocator_type())
    1004                 :          7 :     : m_buff(0), m_end(0), m_first(0), m_last(0), m_size(0), m_alloc(alloc) {}
    1005                 :            : 
    1006                 :            :     //! Create an empty <code>circular_buffer</code> with the specified capacity.
    1007                 :            :     /*!
    1008                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == buffer_capacity \&\& size() == 0</code>

    1013                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1014                 :            :              Constant.
    1015                 :            :     */

    1019                 :            :         m_first = m_last = m_buff;

    1022                 :            :     /*! \brief Create a full <code>circular_buffer</code> with the specified capacity and filled with <code>n</code>
    1023                 :            :                copies of <code>item</code>.
    1024                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == n \&\& full() \&\& (*this)[0] == item \&\& (*this)[1] == item \&\& ... \&\&
    1025                 :            :               (*this)[n - 1] == item </code>

    1032                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1033                 :            :              Linear (in the <code>n</code>).
    1034                 :            :     */
    1035                 :            :     circular_buffer(size_type n, param_value_type item, const allocator_type& alloc = allocator_type())

    1037                 :            :         initialize_buffer(n, item);
    1038                 :            :         m_first = m_last = m_buff;
    1039                 :            :     }
    1040                 :            : 
    1041                 :            :     /*! \brief Create a <code>circular_buffer</code> with the specified capacity and filled with <code>n</code>
    1042                 :            :                copies of <code>item</code>.
    1043                 :            :         \pre <code>buffer_capacity >= n</code>
    1044                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == buffer_capacity \&\& size() == n \&\& (*this)[0] == item \&\& (*this)[1] == item
    1045                 :            :               \&\& ... \&\& (*this)[n - 1] == item</code>
    1046                 :            :         \param buffer_capacity The capacity of the created <code>circular_buffer</code>.
    1047                 :            :         \param n The number of elements the created <code>circular_buffer</code> will be filled with.
    1048                 :            :         \param item The element the created <code>circular_buffer</code> will be filled with.
    1049                 :            :         \param alloc The allocator.
    1050                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
    1051                 :            :                 used).
    1052                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1053                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1054                 :            :              Linear (in the <code>n</code>).
    1055                 :            :     */
    1056                 :            :     circular_buffer(capacity_type buffer_capacity, size_type n, param_value_type item,
    1057                 :            :         const allocator_type& alloc = allocator_type())
    1058                 :            :     : m_size(n), m_alloc(alloc) {
    1059                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(buffer_capacity >= size()); // check for capacity lower than size
    1060                 :            :         initialize_buffer(buffer_capacity, item);
    1061                 :            :         m_first = m_buff;
    1062                 :            :         m_last = buffer_capacity == n ? m_buff : m_buff + n;
    1063                 :            :     }
    1064                 :            : 
    1065                 :            :     //! The copy constructor.
    1066                 :            :     /*!
    1067                 :            :         Creates a copy of the specified <code>circular_buffer</code>.
    1068                 :            :         \post <code>*this == cb</code>
    1069                 :            :         \param cb The <code>circular_buffer</code> to be copied.
    1070                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
    1071                 :            :                 used).
    1072                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1073                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1074                 :            :              Linear (in the size of <code>cb</code>).
    1075                 :            :     */
    1076                 :            :     circular_buffer(const circular_buffer<T, Alloc>& cb)
    1077                 :            :     :
    1078                 :            : #if BOOST_CB_ENABLE_DEBUG
    1079                 :            :     debug_iterator_registry(),
    1080                 :            : #endif
    1081                 :            :     m_size(cb.size()), m_alloc(cb.get_allocator()) {
    1082                 :            :         initialize_buffer(cb.capacity());
    1083                 :            :         m_first = m_buff;
    1084                 :            :         BOOST_TRY {
    1085                 :            :             m_last = cb_details::uninitialized_copy_with_alloc(cb.begin(), cb.end(), m_buff, m_alloc);
    1086                 :            :         } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
    1087                 :            :             deallocate(m_buff, cb.capacity());
    1088                 :            :             BOOST_RETHROW
    1089                 :            :         }
    1090                 :            :         BOOST_CATCH_END
    1091                 :            :         if (m_last == m_end)
    1092                 :            :             m_last = m_buff;
    1093                 :            :     }

    1101                 :            :         initialize(first, last, is_integral<InputIterator>());

    1106                 :            :     : m_alloc(allocator_type()) {
    1107                 :            :         initialize(capacity, first, last, is_integral<InputIterator>());
    1108                 :            :     }

    1110                 :            :

    1113                 :            :     //! Create a full <code>circular_buffer</code> filled with a copy of the range.
    1114                 :            :     /*!
    1115                 :            :         \pre Valid range <code>[first, last)</code>.<br>
    1116                 :            :              <code>first</code> and <code>last</code> have to meet the requirements of
    1117                 :            :              <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/InputIterator.html">InputIterator</a>.
    1118                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == std::distance(first, last) \&\& full() \&\& (*this)[0]== *first \&\&
    1119                 :            :               (*this)[1] == *(first + 1) \&\& ... \&\& (*this)[std::distance(first, last) - 1] == *(last - 1)</code>
    1120                 :            :         \param first The beginning of the range to be copied.
    1121                 :            :         \param last The end of the range to be copied.
    1122                 :            :         \param alloc The allocator.
    1123                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
    1124                 :            :                 used).
    1125                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1126                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1127                 :            :              Linear (in the <code>std::distance(first, last)</code>).
    1128                 :            :     */
    1129                 :            :     template <class InputIterator>
    1130                 :            :     circular_buffer(InputIterator first, InputIterator last, const allocator_type& alloc = allocator_type())
    1131                 :            :     : m_alloc(alloc) {
    1132                 :            :         initialize(first, last, is_integral<InputIterator>());
    1133                 :            :     }
    1134                 :            : 
    1135                 :            :     //! Create a <code>circular_buffer</code> with the specified capacity and filled with a copy of the range.
    1136                 :            :     /*!
    1137                 :            :         \pre Valid range <code>[first, last)</code>.<br>
    1138                 :            :              <code>first</code> and <code>last</code> have to meet the requirements of
    1139                 :            :              <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/InputIterator.html">InputIterator</a>.
    1140                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == buffer_capacity \&\& size() \<= std::distance(first, last) \&\&
    1141                 :            :              (*this)[0]== *(last - buffer_capacity) \&\& (*this)[1] == *(last - buffer_capacity + 1) \&\& ... \&\&
    1142                 :            :              (*this)[buffer_capacity - 1] == *(last - 1)</code><br><br>
    1143                 :            :              If the number of items to be copied from the range <code>[first, last)</code> is greater than the
    1144                 :            :              specified <code>buffer_capacity</code> then only elements from the range
    1145                 :            :              <code>[last - buffer_capacity, last)</code> will be copied.
    1146                 :            :         \param buffer_capacity The capacity of the created <code>circular_buffer</code>.
    1147                 :            :         \param first The beginning of the range to be copied.
    1148                 :            :         \param last The end of the range to be copied.
    1149                 :            :         \param alloc The allocator.
    1150                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
    1151                 :            :                 used).
    1152                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1153                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1154                 :            :              Linear (in <code>std::distance(first, last)</code>; in
    1155                 :            :              <code>min[capacity, std::distance(first, last)]</code> if the <code>InputIterator</code> is a
    1156                 :            :              <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/RandomAccessIterator.html">RandomAccessIterator</a>).
    1157                 :            :     */
    1158                 :            :     template <class InputIterator>
    1159                 :            :     circular_buffer(capacity_type buffer_capacity, InputIterator first, InputIterator last,
    1160                 :            :         const allocator_type& alloc = allocator_type())
    1161                 :            :     : m_alloc(alloc) {
    1162                 :            :         initialize(buffer_capacity, first, last, is_integral<InputIterator>());
    1163                 :            :     }
    1164                 :            : 
    1165                 :            : #endif // #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, < 1300)
    1166                 :            : 
    1167                 :            :     //! The destructor.
    1168                 :            :     /*!

    1170                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
    1171                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1172                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (including iterators equal to
    1173                 :            :              <code>end()</code>).
    1174                 :            :         \par Complexity

    1176                 :            :         \sa <code>clear()</code>
    1177                 :            :     */

    1185                 :            : public:
    1186                 :            : // Assign methods
    1187                 :            : 
    1188                 :            :     //! The assign operator.
    1189                 :            :     /*!
    1190                 :            :         Makes this <code>circular_buffer</code> to become a copy of the specified <code>circular_buffer</code>.
    1191                 :            :         \post <code>*this == cb</code>
    1192                 :            :         \param cb The <code>circular_buffer</code> to be copied.
    1193                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
    1194                 :            :                 used).
    1195                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1196                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1197                 :            :              Strong.
    1198                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1199                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to this <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
    1200                 :            :              <code>end()</code>).
    1201                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1202                 :            :              Linear (in the size of <code>cb</code>).
    1203                 :            :         \sa <code>\link assign(size_type, param_value_type) assign(size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>,
    1204                 :            :             <code>\link assign(capacity_type, size_type, param_value_type)
    1205                 :            :             assign(capacity_type, size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>,
    1206                 :            :             <code>assign(InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>,
    1207                 :            :             <code>assign(capacity_type, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>
    1208                 :            :     */
    1209                 :            :     circular_buffer<T, Alloc>& operator = (const circular_buffer<T, Alloc>& cb) {
    1210                 :            :         if (this == &cb)
    1211                 :            :             return *this;
    1212                 :            :         pointer buff = allocate(cb.capacity());
    1213                 :            :         BOOST_TRY {
    1214                 :            :             reset(buff, cb_details::uninitialized_copy_with_alloc(cb.begin(), cb.end(), buff, m_alloc), cb.capacity());
    1215                 :            :         } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
    1216                 :            :             deallocate(buff, cb.capacity());
    1217                 :            :             BOOST_RETHROW
    1218                 :            :         }
    1219                 :            :         BOOST_CATCH_END
    1220                 :            :         return *this;
    1221                 :            :     }
    1222                 :            : 
    1223                 :            :     //! Assign <code>n</code> items into the <code>circular_buffer</code>.

    1226                 :            :         <code>item</code>.
    1227                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == n \&\& size() == n \&\& (*this)[0] == item \&\& (*this)[1] == item \&\& ... \&\&
    1228                 :            :               (*this) [n - 1] == item</code>
    1229                 :            :         \param n The number of elements the <code>circular_buffer</code> will be filled with.
    1230                 :            :         \param item The element the <code>circular_buffer</code> will be filled with.

    1232                 :            :                 used).
    1233                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1234                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1235                 :            :              Basic.
    1236                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1237                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
    1238                 :            :              <code>end()</code>).

    1246                 :            :     */

    1251                 :            :     //! Assign <code>n</code> items into the <code>circular_buffer</code> specifying the capacity.

    1257                 :            :               \&\& ... \&\& (*this) [n - 1] == item </code>

    1260                 :            :         \param item The element the <code>circular_buffer</code> will be filled with.
    1261                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
    1262                 :            :                 used).
    1263                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1264                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1265                 :            :              Basic.
    1266                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1267                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
    1268                 :            :              <code>end()</code>).

    1274                 :            :             <code>assign(capacity_type, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>

    1281                 :            :     //! Assign a copy of the range into the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
    1282                 :            :     /*!
    1283                 :            :         The content of the <code>circular_buffer</code> will be removed and replaced with copies of elements from the
    1284                 :            :         specified range.
    1285                 :            :         \pre Valid range <code>[first, last)</code>.<br>
    1286                 :            :              <code>first</code> and <code>last</code> have to meet the requirements of
    1287                 :            :              <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/InputIterator.html">InputIterator</a>.
    1288                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == std::distance(first, last) \&\& size() == std::distance(first, last) \&\&
    1289                 :            :              (*this)[0]== *first \&\& (*this)[1] == *(first + 1) \&\& ... \&\& (*this)[std::distance(first, last) - 1]
    1290                 :            :              == *(last - 1)</code>
    1291                 :            :         \param first The beginning of the range to be copied.
    1292                 :            :         \param last The end of the range to be copied.
    1293                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
    1294                 :            :                 used).
    1295                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1296                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1297                 :            :              Basic.
    1298                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1299                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
    1300                 :            :              <code>end()</code>).
    1301                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1302                 :            :              Linear (in the <code>std::distance(first, last)</code>).
    1303                 :            :         \sa <code>\link operator=(const circular_buffer&) operator=\endlink</code>,
    1304                 :            :             <code>\link assign(size_type, param_value_type) assign(size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>,
    1305                 :            :             <code>\link assign(capacity_type, size_type, param_value_type)
    1306                 :            :             assign(capacity_type, size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>,
    1307                 :            :             <code>assign(capacity_type, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>
    1308                 :            :     */
    1309                 :            :     template <class InputIterator>
    1310                 :            :     void assign(InputIterator first, InputIterator last) {
    1311                 :            :         assign(first, last, is_integral<InputIterator>());
    1312                 :            :     }

    1314                 :            :     //! Assign a copy of the range into the <code>circular_buffer</code> specifying the capacity.
    1315                 :            :     /*!
    1316                 :            :         The capacity of the <code>circular_buffer</code> will be set to the specified value and the content of the
    1317                 :            :         <code>circular_buffer</code> will be removed and replaced with copies of elements from the specified range.
    1318                 :            :         \pre Valid range <code>[first, last)</code>.<br>
    1319                 :            :              <code>first</code> and <code>last</code> have to meet the requirements of
    1320                 :            :              <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/InputIterator.html">InputIterator</a>.
    1321                 :            :         \post <code>capacity() == buffer_capacity \&\& size() \<= std::distance(first, last) \&\&
    1322                 :            :              (*this)[0]== *(last - buffer_capacity) \&\& (*this)[1] == *(last - buffer_capacity + 1) \&\& ... \&\&
    1323                 :            :              (*this)[buffer_capacity - 1] == *(last - 1)</code><br><br>
    1324                 :            :              If the number of items to be copied from the range <code>[first, last)</code> is greater than the
    1325                 :            :              specified <code>buffer_capacity</code> then only elements from the range
    1326                 :            :              <code>[last - buffer_capacity, last)</code> will be copied.
    1327                 :            :         \param buffer_capacity The new capacity.
    1328                 :            :         \param first The beginning of the range to be copied.
    1329                 :            :         \param last The end of the range to be copied.
    1330                 :            :         \throws "An allocation error" if memory is exhausted (<code>std::bad_alloc</code> if the standard allocator is
    1331                 :            :                 used).
    1332                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1333                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1334                 :            :              Basic.
    1335                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1336                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
    1337                 :            :              <code>end()</code>).
    1338                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1339                 :            :              Linear (in <code>std::distance(first, last)</code>; in
    1340                 :            :              <code>min[capacity, std::distance(first, last)]</code> if the <code>InputIterator</code> is a
    1341                 :            :              <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/RandomAccessIterator.html">RandomAccessIterator</a>).
    1342                 :            :         \sa <code>\link operator=(const circular_buffer&) operator=\endlink</code>,
    1343                 :            :             <code>\link assign(size_type, param_value_type) assign(size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>,
    1344                 :            :             <code>\link assign(capacity_type, size_type, param_value_type)
    1345                 :            :             assign(capacity_type, size_type, const_reference)\endlink</code>,
    1346                 :            :             <code>assign(InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>
    1347                 :            :     */
    1348                 :            :     template <class InputIterator>
    1349                 :            :     void assign(capacity_type buffer_capacity, InputIterator first, InputIterator last) {
    1350                 :            :         assign(buffer_capacity, first, last, is_integral<InputIterator>());
    1351                 :            :     }
    1352                 :            : 
    1353                 :            :     //! Swap the contents of two <code>circular_buffer</code>s.
    1354                 :            :     /*!
    1355                 :            :         \post <code>this</code> contains elements of <code>cb</code> and vice versa; the capacity of <code>this</code>
    1356                 :            :               equals to the capacity of <code>cb</code> and vice versa.
    1357                 :            :         \param cb The <code>circular_buffer</code> whose content will be swapped.
    1358                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
    1359                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1360                 :            :              No-throw.
    1361                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation

    1363                 :            :              point to the same elements but within another container. If you want to rely on this feature you have to
    1364                 :            :              turn the <a href="#debug">Debug Support</a> off otherwise an assertion will report an error if such
    1365                 :            :              invalidated iterator is used.)
    1366                 :            :         \par Complexity

    1368                 :            :         \sa <code>swap(circular_buffer<T, Alloc>&, circular_buffer<T, Alloc>&)</code>
    1369                 :            :     */
