    1498                 :            :     //! Insert an element at the specified position.
    1499                 :            :     /*!
    1500                 :            :         \pre <code>pos</code> is a valid iterator pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> or its end.
    1501                 :            :         \post The <code>item</code> will be inserted at the position <code>pos</code>.<br>
    1502                 :            :               If the <code>circular_buffer</code> is full, the first element will be overwritten. If the
    1503                 :            :               <code>circular_buffer</code> is full and the <code>pos</code> points to <code>begin()</code>, then the
    1504                 :            :               <code>item</code> will not be inserted. If the capacity is <code>0</code>, nothing will be inserted.
    1505                 :            :         \param pos An iterator specifying the position where the <code>item</code> will be inserted.
    1506                 :            :         \param item The element to be inserted.
    1507                 :            :         \return Iterator to the inserted element or <code>begin()</code> if the <code>item</code> is not inserted. (See
    1508                 :            :                 the <i>Effect</i>.)
    1509                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1510                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1511                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1512                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operation in the <i>Throws</i> section does not throw anything.
    1513                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1514                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the elements at the insertion point (including <code>pos</code>) and
    1515                 :            :              iterators behind the insertion point (towards the end; except iterators equal to <code>end()</code>). It
    1516                 :            :              also invalidates iterators pointing to the overwritten element.
    1517                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1518                 :            :              Linear (in <code>std::distance(pos, end())</code>).
    1519                 :            :         \sa <code>\link insert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1520                 :            :             insert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1521                 :            :             <code>insert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>,
    1522                 :            :             <code>\link rinsert(iterator, param_value_type) rinsert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1523                 :            :             <code>\link rinsert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1524                 :            :             rinsert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1525                 :            :             <code>rinsert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>
    1526                 :            :     */
    1527                 :            :     iterator insert(iterator pos, param_value_type item = value_type()) {
    1528                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1529                 :            :         iterator b = begin();
    1530                 :            :         if (full() && pos == b)
    1531                 :            :             return b;
    1532                 :            :         return insert_item(pos, item);
    1533                 :            :     }
    1534                 :            : 
    1535                 :            :     //! Insert <code>n</code> copies of the <code>item</code> at the specified position.
    1536                 :            :     /*!
    1537                 :            :         \pre <code>pos</code> is a valid iterator pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> or its end.
    1538                 :            :         \post The number of <code>min[n, (pos - begin()) + reserve()]</code> elements will be inserted at the position
    1539                 :            :               <code>pos</code>.<br>The number of <code>min[pos - begin(), max[0, n - reserve()]]</code> elements will
    1540                 :            :               be overwritten at the beginning of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.<br>(See <i>Example</i> for the
    1541                 :            :               explanation.)
    1542                 :            :         \param pos An iterator specifying the position where the <code>item</code>s will be inserted.
    1543                 :            :         \param n The number of <code>item</code>s the to be inserted.
    1544                 :            :         \param item The element whose copies will be inserted.
    1545                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1546                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1547                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1548                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operations in the <i>Throws</i> section do not throw anything.
    1549                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1550                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the elements at the insertion point (including <code>pos</code>) and
    1551                 :            :              iterators behind the insertion point (towards the end; except iterators equal to <code>end()</code>). It
    1552                 :            :              also invalidates iterators pointing to the overwritten elements.
    1553                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1554                 :            :              Linear (in <code>min[capacity(), std::distance(pos, end()) + n]</code>).
    1555                 :            :         \par Example
    1556                 :            :              Consider a <code>circular_buffer</code> with the capacity of 6 and the size of 4. Its internal buffer may
    1557                 :            :              look like the one below.<br><br>
    1558                 :            :              <code>|1|2|3|4| | |</code><br>
    1559                 :            :              <code>p ---^</code><br><br>After inserting 5 elements at the position <code>p</code>:<br><br>
    1560                 :            :              <code>insert(p, (size_t)5, 0);</code><br><br>actually only 4 elements get inserted and elements
    1561                 :            :              <code>1</code> and <code>2</code> are overwritten. This is due to the fact the insert operation preserves
    1562                 :            :              the capacity. After insertion the internal buffer looks like this:<br><br><code>|0|0|0|0|3|4|</code><br>
    1563                 :            :              <br>For comparison if the capacity would not be preserved the internal buffer would then result in
    1564                 :            :              <code>|1|2|0|0|0|0|0|3|4|</code>.
    1565                 :            :         \sa <code>\link insert(iterator, param_value_type) insert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1566                 :            :             <code>insert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>,
    1567                 :            :             <code>\link rinsert(iterator, param_value_type) rinsert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1568                 :            :             <code>\link rinsert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1569                 :            :             rinsert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1570                 :            :             <code>rinsert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>
    1571                 :            :     */
    1572                 :            :     void insert(iterator pos, size_type n, param_value_type item) {
    1573                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1574                 :            :         if (n == 0)
    1575                 :            :             return;
    1576                 :            :         size_type copy = capacity() - (end() - pos);
    1577                 :            :         if (copy == 0)
    1578                 :            :             return;
    1579                 :            :         if (n > copy)
    1580                 :            :             n = copy;
    1581                 :            :         insert_n(pos, n, cb_details::item_wrapper<const_pointer, param_value_type>(item));
    1582                 :            :     }
    1583                 :            : 
    1584                 :            :     //! Insert the range <code>[first, last)</code> at the specified position.
    1585                 :            :     /*!
    1586                 :            :         \pre <code>pos</code> is a valid iterator pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> or its end.<br>
    1587                 :            :              Valid range <code>[first, last)</code> where <code>first</code> and <code>last</code> meet the
    1588                 :            :              requirements of an <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/InputIterator.html">InputIterator</a>.
    1589                 :            :         \post Elements from the range
    1590                 :            :               <code>[first + max[0, distance(first, last) - (pos - begin()) - reserve()], last)</code> will be
    1591                 :            :               inserted at the position <code>pos</code>.<br>The number of <code>min[pos - begin(), max[0,
    1592                 :            :               distance(first, last) - reserve()]]</code> elements will be overwritten at the beginning of the
    1593                 :            :               <code>circular_buffer</code>.<br>(See <i>Example</i> for the explanation.)
    1594                 :            :         \param pos An iterator specifying the position where the range will be inserted.
    1595                 :            :         \param first The beginning of the range to be inserted.
    1596                 :            :         \param last The end of the range to be inserted.
    1597                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1598                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1599                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1600                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operations in the <i>Throws</i> section do not throw anything.
    1601                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1602                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the elements at the insertion point (including <code>pos</code>) and
    1603                 :            :              iterators behind the insertion point (towards the end; except iterators equal to <code>end()</code>). It
    1604                 :            :              also invalidates iterators pointing to the overwritten elements.
    1605                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1606                 :            :              Linear (in <code>[std::distance(pos, end()) + std::distance(first, last)]</code>; in
    1607                 :            :              <code>min[capacity(), std::distance(pos, end()) + std::distance(first, last)]</code> if the
    1608                 :            :              <code>InputIterator</code> is a
    1609                 :            :              <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/RandomAccessIterator.html">RandomAccessIterator</a>).
    1610                 :            :         \par Example
    1611                 :            :              Consider a <code>circular_buffer</code> with the capacity of 6 and the size of 4. Its internal buffer may
    1612                 :            :              look like the one below.<br><br>
    1613                 :            :              <code>|1|2|3|4| | |</code><br>
    1614                 :            :              <code>p ---^</code><br><br>After inserting a range of elements at the position <code>p</code>:<br><br>
    1615                 :            :              <code>int array[] = { 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 };</code><br><code>insert(p, array, array + 5);</code><br><br>
    1616                 :            :              actually only elements <code>6</code>, <code>7</code>, <code>8</code> and <code>9</code> from the
    1617                 :            :              specified range get inserted and elements <code>1</code> and <code>2</code> are overwritten. This is due
    1618                 :            :              to the fact the insert operation preserves the capacity. After insertion the internal buffer looks like
    1619                 :            :              this:<br><br><code>|6|7|8|9|3|4|</code><br><br>For comparison if the capacity would not be preserved the
    1620                 :            :              internal buffer would then result in <code>|1|2|5|6|7|8|9|3|4|</code>.
    1621                 :            :         \sa <code>\link insert(iterator, param_value_type) insert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1622                 :            :             <code>\link insert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1623                 :            :             insert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>, <code>\link rinsert(iterator, param_value_type)
    1624                 :            :             rinsert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>, <code>\link rinsert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1625                 :            :             rinsert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1626                 :            :             <code>rinsert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>
    1627                 :            :     */
    1628                 :            :     template <class InputIterator>
    1629                 :            :     void insert(iterator pos, InputIterator first, InputIterator last) {
    1630                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1631                 :            :         insert(pos, first, last, is_integral<InputIterator>());
    1632                 :            :     }
    1633                 :            : 
    1634                 :            :     //! Insert an element before the specified position.
    1635                 :            :     /*!
    1636                 :            :         \pre <code>pos</code> is a valid iterator pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> or its end.
    1637                 :            :         \post The <code>item</code> will be inserted before the position <code>pos</code>.<br>
    1638                 :            :               If the <code>circular_buffer</code> is full, the last element will be overwritten. If the
    1639                 :            :               <code>circular_buffer</code> is full and the <code>pos</code> points to <code>end()</code>, then the
    1640                 :            :               <code>item</code> will not be inserted. If the capacity is <code>0</code>, nothing will be inserted.
    1641                 :            :         \param pos An iterator specifying the position before which the <code>item</code> will be inserted.
    1642                 :            :         \param item The element to be inserted.
    1643                 :            :         \return Iterator to the inserted element or <code>end()</code> if the <code>item</code> is not inserted. (See
    1644                 :            :                 the <i>Effect</i>.)
    1645                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1646                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1647                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1648                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operations in the <i>Throws</i> section do not throw anything.
    1649                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1650                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the elements before the insertion point (towards the beginning and
    1651                 :            :              excluding <code>pos</code>). It also invalidates iterators pointing to the overwritten element.
    1652                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1653                 :            :              Linear (in <code>std::distance(begin(), pos)</code>).
    1654                 :            :         \sa <code>\link rinsert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1655                 :            :             rinsert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1656                 :            :             <code>rinsert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>,
    1657                 :            :             <code>\link insert(iterator, param_value_type) insert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1658                 :            :             <code>\link insert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1659                 :            :             insert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1660                 :            :             <code>insert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>
    1661                 :            :     */
    1662                 :            :     iterator rinsert(iterator pos, param_value_type item = value_type()) {
    1663                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1664                 :            :         if (full() && pos.m_it == 0)
    1665                 :            :             return end();
    1666                 :            :         if (pos == begin()) {
    1667                 :            :             BOOST_TRY {
    1668                 :            :                 decrement(m_first);
    1669                 :            :                 construct_or_replace(!full(), m_first, item);
    1670                 :            :             } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
    1671                 :            :                 increment(m_first);
    1672                 :            :                 BOOST_RETHROW
    1673                 :            :             }
    1674                 :            :             BOOST_CATCH_END
    1675                 :            :             pos.m_it = m_first;
    1676                 :            :         } else {
    1677                 :            :             pointer src = m_first;
    1678                 :            :             pointer dest = m_first;
    1679                 :            :             decrement(dest);
    1680                 :            :             pos.m_it = map_pointer(pos.m_it);
    1681                 :            :             bool construct = !full();
    1682                 :            :             BOOST_TRY {
    1683                 :            :                 while (src != pos.m_it) {
    1684                 :            :                     construct_or_replace(construct, dest, *src);
    1685                 :            :                     increment(src);
    1686                 :            :                     increment(dest);
    1687                 :            :                     construct = false;
    1688                 :            :                 }
    1689                 :            :                 decrement(pos.m_it);
    1690                 :            :                 replace(pos.m_it, item);
    1691                 :            :             } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
    1692                 :            :                 if (!construct && !full()) {
    1693                 :            :                     decrement(m_first);
    1694                 :            :                     ++m_size;
    1695                 :            :                 }
    1696                 :            :                 BOOST_RETHROW
    1697                 :            :             }
    1698                 :            :             BOOST_CATCH_END
    1699                 :            :             decrement(m_first);
    1700                 :            :         }
    1701                 :            :         if (full())
    1702                 :            :             m_last = m_first;
    1703                 :            :         else
    1704                 :            :             ++m_size;
    1705                 :            :         return iterator(this, pos.m_it);
    1706                 :            :     }
    1707                 :            : 
    1708                 :            :     //! Insert <code>n</code> copies of the <code>item</code> before the specified position.
    1709                 :            :     /*!
    1710                 :            :         \pre <code>pos</code> is a valid iterator pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> or its end.
    1711                 :            :         \post The number of <code>min[n, (end() - pos) + reserve()]</code> elements will be inserted before the
    1712                 :            :               position <code>pos</code>.<br>The number of <code>min[end() - pos, max[0, n - reserve()]]</code> elements
    1713                 :            :               will be overwritten at the end of the <code>circular_buffer</code>.<br>(See <i>Example</i> for the
    1714                 :            :               explanation.)
    1715                 :            :         \param pos An iterator specifying the position where the <code>item</code>s will be inserted.
    1716                 :            :         \param n The number of <code>item</code>s the to be inserted.
    1717                 :            :         \param item The element whose copies will be inserted.
    1718                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1719                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1720                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1721                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operations in the <i>Throws</i> section do not throw anything.
    1722                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1723                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the elements before the insertion point (towards the beginning and
    1724                 :            :              excluding <code>pos</code>). It also invalidates iterators pointing to the overwritten elements.
    1725                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1726                 :            :              Linear (in <code>min[capacity(), std::distance(begin(), pos) + n]</code>).
    1727                 :            :         \par Example
    1728                 :            :              Consider a <code>circular_buffer</code> with the capacity of 6 and the size of 4. Its internal buffer may
    1729                 :            :              look like the one below.<br><br>
    1730                 :            :              <code>|1|2|3|4| | |</code><br>
    1731                 :            :              <code>p ---^</code><br><br>After inserting 5 elements before the position <code>p</code>:<br><br>
    1732                 :            :              <code>rinsert(p, (size_t)5, 0);</code><br><br>actually only 4 elements get inserted and elements
    1733                 :            :              <code>3</code> and <code>4</code> are overwritten. This is due to the fact the rinsert operation preserves
    1734                 :            :              the capacity. After insertion the internal buffer looks like this:<br><br><code>|1|2|0|0|0|0|</code><br>
    1735                 :            :              <br>For comparison if the capacity would not be preserved the internal buffer would then result in
    1736                 :            :              <code>|1|2|0|0|0|0|0|3|4|</code>.
    1737                 :            :         \sa <code>\link rinsert(iterator, param_value_type) rinsert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1738                 :            :             <code>rinsert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>,
    1739                 :            :             <code>\link insert(iterator, param_value_type) insert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1740                 :            :             <code>\link insert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1741                 :            :             insert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1742                 :            :             <code>insert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>
    1743                 :            :     */
    1744                 :            :     void rinsert(iterator pos, size_type n, param_value_type item) {
    1745                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1746                 :            :         rinsert_n(pos, n, cb_details::item_wrapper<const_pointer, param_value_type>(item));
    1747                 :            :     }
    1748                 :            : 
    1749                 :            :     //! Insert the range <code>[first, last)</code> before the specified position.
    1750                 :            :     /*!
    1751                 :            :         \pre <code>pos</code> is a valid iterator pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> or its end.<br>
    1752                 :            :              Valid range <code>[first, last)</code> where <code>first</code> and <code>last</code> meet the
    1753                 :            :              requirements of an <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/InputIterator.html">InputIterator</a>.
    1754                 :            :         \post Elements from the range
    1755                 :            :               <code>[first, last - max[0, distance(first, last) - (end() - pos) - reserve()])</code> will be inserted
    1756                 :            :               before the position <code>pos</code>.<br>The number of <code>min[end() - pos, max[0,
    1757                 :            :               distance(first, last) - reserve()]]</code> elements will be overwritten at the end of the
    1758                 :            :               <code>circular_buffer</code>.<br>(See <i>Example</i> for the explanation.)
    1759                 :            :         \param pos An iterator specifying the position where the range will be inserted.
    1760                 :            :         \param first The beginning of the range to be inserted.
    1761                 :            :         \param last The end of the range to be inserted.
    1762                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::T(const T&)</code> throws.
    1763                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1764                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1765                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operations in the <i>Throws</i> section do not throw anything.
    1766                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1767                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the elements before the insertion point (towards the beginning and
    1768                 :            :              excluding <code>pos</code>). It also invalidates iterators pointing to the overwritten elements.
    1769                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1770                 :            :              Linear (in <code>[std::distance(begin(), pos) + std::distance(first, last)]</code>; in
    1771                 :            :              <code>min[capacity(), std::distance(begin(), pos) + std::distance(first, last)]</code> if the
    1772                 :            :              <code>InputIterator</code> is a
    1773                 :            :              <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/RandomAccessIterator.html">RandomAccessIterator</a>).
    1774                 :            :         \par Example
    1775                 :            :              Consider a <code>circular_buffer</code> with the capacity of 6 and the size of 4. Its internal buffer may
    1776                 :            :              look like the one below.<br><br>
    1777                 :            :              <code>|1|2|3|4| | |</code><br>
    1778                 :            :              <code>p ---^</code><br><br>After inserting a range of elements before the position <code>p</code>:<br><br>
    1779                 :            :              <code>int array[] = { 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 };</code><br><code>insert(p, array, array + 5);</code><br><br>
    1780                 :            :              actually only elements <code>5</code>, <code>6</code>, <code>7</code> and <code>8</code> from the
    1781                 :            :              specified range get inserted and elements <code>3</code> and <code>4</code> are overwritten. This is due
    1782                 :            :              to the fact the rinsert operation preserves the capacity. After insertion the internal buffer looks like
    1783                 :            :              this:<br><br><code>|1|2|5|6|7|8|</code><br><br>For comparison if the capacity would not be preserved the
    1784                 :            :              internal buffer would then result in <code>|1|2|5|6|7|8|9|3|4|</code>.
    1785                 :            :         \sa <code>\link rinsert(iterator, param_value_type) rinsert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1786                 :            :             <code>\link rinsert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1787                 :            :             rinsert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>, <code>\link insert(iterator, param_value_type)
    1788                 :            :             insert(iterator, value_type)\endlink</code>, <code>\link insert(iterator, size_type, param_value_type)
    1789                 :            :             insert(iterator, size_type, value_type)\endlink</code>,
    1790                 :            :             <code>insert(iterator, InputIterator, InputIterator)</code>
    1791                 :            :     */
    1792                 :            :     template <class InputIterator>
    1793                 :            :     void rinsert(iterator pos, InputIterator first, InputIterator last) {
    1794                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1795                 :            :         rinsert(pos, first, last, is_integral<InputIterator>());
    1796                 :            :     }
    1797                 :            : 
    1798                 :            : // Erase
    1799                 :            : 
    1800                 :            :     //! Remove an element at the specified position.
    1801                 :            :     /*!
    1802                 :            :         \pre <code>pos</code> is a valid iterator pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (but not an
    1803                 :            :              <code>end()</code>).
    1804                 :            :         \post The element at the position <code>pos</code> is removed.
    1805                 :            :         \param pos An iterator pointing at the element to be removed.
    1806                 :            :         \return Iterator to the first element remaining beyond the removed element or <code>end()</code> if no such
    1807                 :            :                 element exists.
    1808                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1809                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1810                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operation in the <i>Throws</i> section does not throw anything.
    1811                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1812                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the erased element and iterators pointing to the elements behind
    1813                 :            :              the erased element (towards the end; except iterators equal to <code>end()</code>).
    1814                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1815                 :            :              Linear (in <code>std::distance(pos, end())</code>).
    1816                 :            :         \sa <code>erase(iterator, iterator)</code>, <code>rerase(iterator)</code>,
    1817                 :            :             <code>rerase(iterator, iterator)</code>, <code>erase_begin(size_type)</code>,
    1818                 :            :             <code>erase_end(size_type)</code>, <code>clear()</code>
    1819                 :            :     */
    1820                 :            :     iterator erase(iterator pos) {
    1821                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1822                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.m_it != 0);      // check for iterator pointing to end()
    1823                 :            :         pointer next = pos.m_it;
    1824                 :            :         increment(next);
    1825                 :            :         for (pointer p = pos.m_it; next != m_last; p = next, increment(next))
    1826                 :            :             replace(p, *next);
    1827                 :            :         decrement(m_last);
    1828                 :            :         destroy_item(m_last);
    1829                 :            :         --m_size;
    1830                 :            : #if BOOST_CB_ENABLE_DEBUG
    1831                 :            :         return m_last == pos.m_it ? end() : iterator(this, pos.m_it);
    1832                 :            : #else
    1833                 :            :         return m_last == pos.m_it ? end() : pos;
    1834                 :            : #endif
    1835                 :            :     }
    1836                 :            : 
    1837                 :            :     //! Erase the range <code>[first, last)</code>.
    1838                 :            :     /*!
    1839                 :            :         \pre Valid range <code>[first, last)</code>.
    1840                 :            :         \post The elements from the range <code>[first, last)</code> are removed. (If <code>first == last</code>
    1841                 :            :               nothing is removed.)
    1842                 :            :         \param first The beginning of the range to be removed.
    1843                 :            :         \param last The end of the range to be removed.
    1844                 :            :         \return Iterator to the first element remaining beyond the removed elements or <code>end()</code> if no such
    1845                 :            :                 element exists.
    1846                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1847                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1848                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operation in the <i>Throws</i> section does not throw anything.
    1849                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1850                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the erased elements and iterators pointing to the elements behind
    1851                 :            :              the erased range (towards the end; except iterators equal to <code>end()</code>).
    1852                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1853                 :            :              Linear (in <code>std::distance(first, end())</code>).
    1854                 :            :         \sa <code>erase(iterator)</code>, <code>rerase(iterator)</code>, <code>rerase(iterator, iterator)</code>,
    1855                 :            :             <code>erase_begin(size_type)</code>, <code>erase_end(size_type)</code>, <code>clear()</code>
    1856                 :            :     */
    1857                 :            :     iterator erase(iterator first, iterator last) {
    1858                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(first.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1859                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(last.is_valid(this));  // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1860                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(first <= last);        // check for wrong range
    1861                 :            :         if (first == last)
    1862                 :            :             return first;
    1863                 :            :         pointer p = first.m_it;
    1864                 :            :         while (last.m_it != 0)
    1865                 :            :             replace((first++).m_it, *last++);
    1866                 :            :         do {
    1867                 :            :             decrement(m_last);
    1868                 :            :             destroy_item(m_last);
    1869                 :            :             --m_size;
    1870                 :            :         } while(m_last != first.m_it);
    1871                 :            :         return m_last == p ? end() : iterator(this, p);
    1872                 :            :     }
    1873                 :            : 
    1874                 :            :     //! Remove an element at the specified position.
    1875                 :            :     /*!
    1876                 :            :         \pre <code>pos</code> is a valid iterator pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (but not an
    1877                 :            :              <code>end()</code>).
    1878                 :            :         \post The element at the position <code>pos</code> is removed.
    1879                 :            :         \param pos An iterator pointing at the element to be removed.
    1880                 :            :         \return Iterator to the first element remaining in front of the removed element or <code>begin()</code> if no
    1881                 :            :                 such element exists.
    1882                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1883                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1884                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operation in the <i>Throws</i> section does not throw anything.
    1885                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1886                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the erased element and iterators pointing to the elements in front of
    1887                 :            :              the erased element (towards the beginning).
    1888                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1889                 :            :              Linear (in <code>std::distance(begin(), pos)</code>).
    1890                 :            :         \note This method is symetric to the <code>erase(iterator)</code> method and is more effective than
    1891                 :            :               <code>erase(iterator)</code> if the iterator <code>pos</code> is close to the beginning of the
    1892                 :            :               <code>circular_buffer</code>. (See the <i>Complexity</i>.)
    1893                 :            :         \sa <code>erase(iterator)</code>, <code>erase(iterator, iterator)</code>,
    1894                 :            :             <code>rerase(iterator, iterator)</code>, <code>erase_begin(size_type)</code>,
    1895                 :            :             <code>erase_end(size_type)</code>, <code>clear()</code>
    1896                 :            :     */
    1897                 :            :     iterator rerase(iterator pos) {
    1898                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1899                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(pos.m_it != 0);      // check for iterator pointing to end()
    1900                 :            :         pointer prev = pos.m_it;
    1901                 :            :         pointer p = prev;
    1902                 :            :         for (decrement(prev); p != m_first; p = prev, decrement(prev))
    1903                 :            :             replace(p, *prev);
    1904                 :            :         destroy_item(m_first);
    1905                 :            :         increment(m_first);
    1906                 :            :         --m_size;
    1907                 :            : #if BOOST_CB_ENABLE_DEBUG
    1908                 :            :         return p == pos.m_it ? begin() : iterator(this, pos.m_it);
    1909                 :            : #else
    1910                 :            :         return p == pos.m_it ? begin() : pos;
    1911                 :            : #endif
    1912                 :            :     }
    1913                 :            : 
    1914                 :            :     //! Erase the range <code>[first, last)</code>.
    1915                 :            :     /*!
    1916                 :            :         \pre Valid range <code>[first, last)</code>.
    1917                 :            :         \post The elements from the range <code>[first, last)</code> are removed. (If <code>first == last</code>
    1918                 :            :               nothing is removed.)
    1919                 :            :         \param first The beginning of the range to be removed.
    1920                 :            :         \param last The end of the range to be removed.
    1921                 :            :         \return Iterator to the first element remaining in front of the removed elements or <code>begin()</code> if no
    1922                 :            :                 such element exists.
    1923                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws.
    1924                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1925                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operation in the <i>Throws</i> section does not throw anything.
    1926                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1927                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the erased elements and iterators pointing to the elements in front of
    1928                 :            :              the erased range (towards the beginning).
    1929                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1930                 :            :              Linear (in <code>std::distance(begin(), last)</code>).
    1931                 :            :         \note This method is symetric to the <code>erase(iterator, iterator)</code> method and is more effective than
    1932                 :            :               <code>erase(iterator, iterator)</code> if <code>std::distance(begin(), first)</code> is lower that
    1933                 :            :               <code>std::distance(last, end())</code>.
    1934                 :            :         \sa <code>erase(iterator)</code>, <code>erase(iterator, iterator)</code>, <code>rerase(iterator)</code>,
    1935                 :            :             <code>erase_begin(size_type)</code>, <code>erase_end(size_type)</code>, <code>clear()</code>
    1936                 :            :     */
    1937                 :            :     iterator rerase(iterator first, iterator last) {
    1938                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(first.is_valid(this)); // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1939                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(last.is_valid(this));  // check for uninitialized or invalidated iterator
    1940                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(first <= last);        // check for wrong range
    1941                 :            :         if (first == last)
    1942                 :            :             return first;
    1943                 :            :         pointer p = map_pointer(last.m_it);
    1944                 :            :         last.m_it = p;
    1945                 :            :         while (first.m_it != m_first) {
    1946                 :            :             decrement(first.m_it);
    1947                 :            :             decrement(p);
    1948                 :            :             replace(p, *first.m_it);
    1949                 :            :         }
    1950                 :            :         do {
    1951                 :            :             destroy_item(m_first);
    1952                 :            :             increment(m_first);
    1953                 :            :             --m_size;
    1954                 :            :         } while(m_first != p);
    1955                 :            :         if (m_first == last.m_it)
    1956                 :            :             return begin();
    1957                 :            :         decrement(last.m_it);
    1958                 :            :         return iterator(this, last.m_it);
    1959                 :            :     }
    1960                 :            : 
    1961                 :            :     //! Remove first <code>n</code> elements (with constant complexity for scalar types).
    1962                 :            :     /*!
    1963                 :            :         \pre <code>n \<= size()</code>
    1964                 :            :         \post The <code>n</code> elements at the beginning of the <code>circular_buffer</code> will be removed.
    1965                 :            :         \param n The number of elements to be removed.
    1966                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws. (Does not throw anything in case of scalars.)
    1967                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    1968                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operation in the <i>Throws</i> section does not throw anything. (I.e. no throw in
    1969                 :            :              case of scalars.)
    1970                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    1971                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the first <code>n</code> erased elements.
    1972                 :            :         \par Complexity
    1973                 :            :              Constant (in <code>n</code>) for scalar types; linear for other types.
    1974                 :            :         \note This method has been specially designed for types which do not require an explicit destructruction (e.g.
    1975                 :            :               integer, float or a pointer). For these scalar types a call to a destructor is not required which makes
    1976                 :            :               it possible to implement the "erase from beginning" operation with a constant complexity. For non-sacalar
    1977                 :            :               types the complexity is linear (hence the explicit destruction is needed) and the implementation is
    1978                 :            :               actually equivalent to
    1979                 :            :               <code>\link circular_buffer::rerase(iterator, iterator) rerase(begin(), begin() + n)\endlink</code>.
    1980                 :            :         \sa <code>erase(iterator)</code>, <code>erase(iterator, iterator)</code>,
    1981                 :            :             <code>rerase(iterator)</code>, <code>rerase(iterator, iterator)</code>,
    1982                 :            :             <code>erase_end(size_type)</code>, <code>clear()</code>
    1983                 :            :     */
    1984                 :            :     void erase_begin(size_type n) {
    1985                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(n <= size()); // check for n greater than size
    1986                 :            : #if BOOST_CB_ENABLE_DEBUG
    1987                 :            :         erase_begin(n, false_type());
    1988                 :            : #else
    1989                 :            :         erase_begin(n, is_scalar<value_type>());
    1990                 :            : #endif
    1991                 :            :     }
    1992                 :            : 
    1993                 :            :     //! Remove last <code>n</code> elements (with constant complexity for scalar types).
    1994                 :            :     /*!
    1995                 :            :         \pre <code>n \<= size()</code>
    1996                 :            :         \post The <code>n</code> elements at the end of the <code>circular_buffer</code> will be removed.
    1997                 :            :         \param n The number of elements to be removed.
    1998                 :            :         \throws Whatever <code>T::operator = (const T&)</code> throws. (Does not throw anything in case of scalars.)
    1999                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    2000                 :            :              Basic; no-throw if the operation in the <i>Throws</i> section does not throw anything. (I.e. no throw in
    2001                 :            :              case of scalars.)
    2002                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    2003                 :            :              Invalidates iterators pointing to the last <code>n</code> erased elements.
    2004                 :            :         \par Complexity
    2005                 :            :              Constant (in <code>n</code>) for scalar types; linear for other types.
    2006                 :            :         \note This method has been specially designed for types which do not require an explicit destructruction (e.g.
    2007                 :            :               integer, float or a pointer). For these scalar types a call to a destructor is not required which makes
    2008                 :            :               it possible to implement the "erase from end" operation with a constant complexity. For non-sacalar
    2009                 :            :               types the complexity is linear (hence the explicit destruction is needed) and the implementation is
    2010                 :            :               actually equivalent to
    2011                 :            :               <code>\link circular_buffer::erase(iterator, iterator) erase(end() - n, end())\endlink</code>.
    2012                 :            :         \sa <code>erase(iterator)</code>, <code>erase(iterator, iterator)</code>,
    2013                 :            :             <code>rerase(iterator)</code>, <code>rerase(iterator, iterator)</code>,
    2014                 :            :             <code>erase_begin(size_type)</code>, <code>clear()</code>
    2015                 :            :     */
    2016                 :            :     void erase_end(size_type n) {
    2017                 :            :         BOOST_CB_ASSERT(n <= size()); // check for n greater than size
    2018                 :            : #if BOOST_CB_ENABLE_DEBUG
    2019                 :            :         erase_end(n, false_type());
    2020                 :            : #else
    2021                 :            :         erase_end(n, is_scalar<value_type>());
    2022                 :            : #endif
    2023                 :            :     }
    2024                 :            : 
    2025                 :            :     //! Remove all stored elements from the <code>circular_buffer</code>.
    2026                 :            :     /*!
    2027                 :            :         \post <code>size() == 0</code>
    2028                 :            :         \throws Nothing.
    2029                 :            :         \par Exception Safety
    2030                 :            :              No-throw.
    2031                 :            :         \par Iterator Invalidation
    2032                 :            :              Invalidates all iterators pointing to the <code>circular_buffer</code> (except iterators equal to
    2033                 :            :              <code>end()</code>).
    2034                 :            :         \par Complexity

    2036                 :            :         \sa <code>~circular_buffer()</code>, <code>erase(iterator)</code>, <code>erase(iterator, iterator)</code>,
    2037                 :            :             <code>rerase(iterator)</code>, <code>rerase(iterator, iterator)</code>,
    2038                 :            :             <code>erase_begin(size_type)</code>, <code>erase_end(size_type)</code>
    2039                 :            :     */
    2040                 :            :     void clear() {
    2041                 :            :         destroy_content();
    2042                 :            :         m_size = 0;
    2043                 :            :     }

    2444                 :            :     iterator insert_item(const iterator& pos, param_value_type item) {
    2445                 :            :         pointer p = pos.m_it;

    2447                 :            :             construct_or_replace(!full(), m_last, item);
    2448                 :            :             p = m_last;
    2449                 :            :         } else {
    2450                 :            :             pointer src = m_last;
    2451                 :            :             pointer dest = m_last;
    2452                 :            :             bool construct = !full();
    2453                 :            :             BOOST_TRY {
    2454                 :            :                 while (src != p) {
    2455                 :            :                     decrement(src);
    2456                 :            :                     construct_or_replace(construct, dest, *src);
    2457                 :            :                     decrement(dest);
    2458                 :            :                     construct = false;
    2459                 :            :                 }

    2467                 :            :             }

    2512                 :            :         if (copy == 0)

    2521                 :            :     //! Helper insert method.
    2522                 :            :     template <class Wrapper>
    2523                 :            :     void insert_n(const iterator& pos, size_type n, const Wrapper& wrapper) {
    2524                 :            :         size_type construct = reserve();
    2525                 :            :         if (construct > n)
    2526                 :            :             construct = n;
    2527                 :            :         if (pos.m_it == 0) {
    2528                 :            :             size_type ii = 0;
    2529                 :            :             pointer p = m_last;
    2530                 :            :             BOOST_TRY {
    2531                 :            :                 for (; ii < construct; ++ii, increment(p))
    2532                 :            :                     m_alloc.construct(p, *wrapper());
    2533                 :            :                 for (;ii < n; ++ii, increment(p))
    2534                 :            :                     replace(p, *wrapper());
    2535                 :            :             } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
    2536                 :            :                 size_type constructed = (std::min)(ii, construct);
    2537                 :            :                 m_last = add(m_last, constructed);
    2538                 :            :                 m_size += constructed;
    2539                 :            :                 BOOST_RETHROW
    2540                 :            :             }
    2541                 :            :             BOOST_CATCH_END
    2542                 :            :         } else {
    2543                 :            :             pointer src = m_last;
    2544                 :            :             pointer dest = add(m_last, n - 1);
    2545                 :            :             pointer p = pos.m_it;
    2546                 :            :             size_type ii = 0;
    2547                 :            :             BOOST_TRY {
    2548                 :            :                 while (src != pos.m_it) {
    2549                 :            :                     decrement(src);
    2550                 :            :                     construct_or_replace(is_uninitialized(dest), dest, *src);
    2551                 :            :                     decrement(dest);
    2552                 :            :                 }
    2553                 :            :                 for (; ii < n; ++ii, increment(p))
    2554                 :            :                     construct_or_replace(is_uninitialized(p), p, *wrapper());
    2555                 :            :             } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
    2556                 :            :                 for (p = add(m_last, n - 1); p != dest; decrement(p))
    2557                 :            :                     destroy_if_constructed(p);
    2558                 :            :                 for (n = 0, p = pos.m_it; n < ii; ++n, increment(p))
    2559                 :            :                     destroy_if_constructed(p);
    2560                 :            :                 BOOST_RETHROW
    2561                 :            :             }
    2562                 :            :             BOOST_CATCH_END
    2563                 :            :         }
    2564                 :            :         m_last = add(m_last, n);
    2565                 :            :         m_first = add(m_first, n - construct);
    2566                 :            :         m_size += construct;
    2567                 :            :     }

    2605                 :            :     //! Helper rinsert method.
    2606                 :            :     template <class Wrapper>
    2607                 :            :     void rinsert_n(const iterator& pos, size_type n, const Wrapper& wrapper) {
    2608                 :            :         if (n == 0)
    2609                 :            :             return;
    2610                 :            :         iterator b = begin();
    2611                 :            :         size_type copy = capacity() - (pos - b);
    2612                 :            :         if (copy == 0)
    2613                 :            :             return;
    2614                 :            :         if (n > copy)
    2615                 :            :             n = copy;
    2616                 :            :         size_type construct = reserve();
    2617                 :            :         if (construct > n)
    2618                 :            :             construct = n;
    2619                 :            :         if (pos == b) {
    2620                 :            :             pointer p = sub(m_first, n);
    2621                 :            :             size_type ii = n;
    2622                 :            :             BOOST_TRY {
    2623                 :            :                 for (;ii > construct; --ii, increment(p))
    2624                 :            :                     replace(p, *wrapper());
    2625                 :            :                 for (; ii > 0; --ii, increment(p))
    2626                 :            :                     m_alloc.construct(p, *wrapper());
    2627                 :            :             } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
    2628                 :            :                 size_type constructed = ii < construct ? construct - ii : 0;
    2629                 :            :                 m_last = add(m_last, constructed);
    2630                 :            :                 m_size += constructed;
    2631                 :            :                 BOOST_RETHROW
    2632                 :            :             }
    2633                 :            :             BOOST_CATCH_END
    2634                 :            :         } else {
    2635                 :            :             pointer src = m_first;
    2636                 :            :             pointer dest = sub(m_first, n);
    2637                 :            :             pointer p = map_pointer(pos.m_it);
    2638                 :            :             BOOST_TRY {
    2639                 :            :                 while (src != p) {
    2640                 :            :                     construct_or_replace(is_uninitialized(dest), dest, *src);
    2641                 :            :                     increment(src);
    2642                 :            :                     increment(dest);
    2643                 :            :                 }
    2644                 :            :                 for (size_type ii = 0; ii < n; ++ii, increment(dest))
    2645                 :            :                     construct_or_replace(is_uninitialized(dest), dest, *wrapper());
    2646                 :            :             } BOOST_CATCH(...) {
    2647                 :            :                 for (src = sub(m_first, n); src != dest; increment(src))
    2648                 :            :                     destroy_if_constructed(src);
    2649                 :            :                 BOOST_RETHROW
    2650                 :            :             }
    2651                 :            :             BOOST_CATCH_END
    2652                 :            :         }
    2653                 :            :         m_first = sub(m_first, n);
    2654                 :            :         m_last = sub(m_last, n - construct);
    2655                 :            :         m_size += construct;
    2656                 :            :     }
    2657                 :            : 
    2658                 :            :     //! Specialized erase_begin method.
    2659                 :            :     void erase_begin(size_type n, const true_type&) {
    2660                 :            :         m_first = add(m_first, n);
    2661                 :            :         m_size -= n;

    2663                 :            : 
    2664                 :            :     //! Specialized erase_begin method.

    2666                 :            :         iterator b = begin();
    2667                 :            :         rerase(b, b + n);

    2669                 :            :

    2681                 :            : };
    2682                 :            : 
    2683                 :            : // Non-member functions
    2684                 :            : 
    2685                 :            : //! Compare two <code>circular_buffer</code>s element-by-element to determine if they are equal.
    2686                 :            : /*!
    2687                 :            :     \param lhs The <code>circular_buffer</code> to compare.
    2688                 :            :     \param rhs The <code>circular_buffer</code> to compare.
    2689                 :            :     \return <code>lhs.\link circular_buffer::size() size()\endlink == rhs.\link circular_buffer::size() size()\endlink
    2690                 :            :             && <a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/equal.html">std::equal</a>(lhs.\link circular_buffer::begin()
    2691                 :            :             begin()\endlink, lhs.\link circular_buffer::end() end()\endlink,
    2692                 :            :             rhs.\link circular_buffer::begin() begin()\endlink)</code>
    2693                 :            :     \throws Nothing.
    2694                 :            :     \par Complexity
    2695                 :            :          Linear (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>s).
    2696                 :            :     \par Iterator Invalidation
    2697                 :            :          Does not invalidate any iterators.
    2698                 :            : */
    2699                 :            : template <class T, class Alloc>
    2700                 :            : inline bool operator == (const circular_buffer<T, Alloc>& lhs, const circular_buffer<T, Alloc>& rhs) {
    2701                 :            :     return lhs.size() == rhs.size() && std::equal(lhs.begin(), lhs.end(), rhs.begin());
    2702                 :            : }
    2703                 :            : 
    2704                 :            : /*!
    2705                 :            :     \brief Compare two <code>circular_buffer</code>s element-by-element to determine if the left one is lesser than the
    2706                 :            :            right one.
    2707                 :            :     \param lhs The <code>circular_buffer</code> to compare.
    2708                 :            :     \param rhs The <code>circular_buffer</code> to compare.
    2709                 :            :     \return <code><a href="http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/lexicographical_compare.html">
    2710                 :            :             std::lexicographical_compare</a>(lhs.\link circular_buffer::begin() begin()\endlink,
    2711                 :            :             lhs.\link circular_buffer::end() end()\endlink, rhs.\link circular_buffer::begin() begin()\endlink,
    2712                 :            :             rhs.\link circular_buffer::end() end()\endlink)</code>
    2713                 :            :     \throws Nothing.
    2714                 :            :     \par Complexity

    2797                 :            : //! Swap the contents of two <code>circular_buffer</code>s.
    2798                 :            : /*!
    2799                 :            :     \post <code>lhs</code> contains elements of <code>rhs</code> and vice versa.
    2800                 :            :     \param lhs The <code>circular_buffer</code> whose content will be swapped with <code>rhs</code>.
    2801                 :            :     \param rhs The <code>circular_buffer</code> whose content will be swapped with <code>lhs</code>.
    2802                 :            :     \throws Nothing.
    2803                 :            :     \par Complexity
    2804                 :            :          Constant (in the size of the <code>circular_buffer</code>s).
    2805                 :            :     \par Iterator Invalidation
    2806                 :            :          Invalidates all iterators of both <code>circular_buffer</code>s. (On the other hand the iterators still
    2807                 :            :          point to the same elements but within another container. If you want to rely on this feature you have to
    2808                 :            :          turn the <a href="#debug">Debug Support</a> off otherwise an assertion will report an error if such
    2809                 :            :          invalidated iterator is used.)
    2810                 :            :     \sa <code>\link circular_buffer::swap(circular_buffer<T, Alloc>&) swap(circular_buffer<T, Alloc>&)\endlink</code>
    2811                 :            : */
    2812                 :            : template <class T, class Alloc>
    2813                 :            : inline void swap(circular_buffer<T, Alloc>& lhs, circular_buffer<T, Alloc>& rhs) {
    2814                 :            :     lhs.swap(rhs);
    2815                 :            : }
